titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Davis Jameson Papers, Photographs and Photograph Albums, 1887-1919 and undated RL.11422
titlestmt.author: Alice L. Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-07-13 10:12:31 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Charles Davis Jameson papers, photographs and photograph albums
did.abstract: Charles Davis Jameson was an American civil engineer who lived and worked on railroads in China with the Perkin Syndicate between 1895-1918. The papers include two letters Jameson wrote to his mother; four diaries, one of which was unused; a 60-page commonplace book mainly filled with handwritten copies of published poetry, and four Japanese lithotints. The rest of the papers comprise eight typescript or published engineering reports authored by Jameson and others on Chinese projects, in English and a few in Chinese, along with two versions of Jameson's typescript description of a trip to Shanxi and Hunan. There are seventeen photograph albums, dated 1898 and undated, featuring 1255 black-and-white photographs ranging in size from 2.25 to 5.75 inches. There are also 5 loose photographs, four black-and-white, and one tinted, ranging in size from 8 x 4.5 inches to 11.5 x 9.5 inches. An additional five black-and-white photographs feature a Chinese man as an archer, holding a stone, and a wielding a kwan dao. These photographs are generally 6 x 8.25 inches and are mounted on 10 x 12.25-inch card stock.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Papers, Photograph albums, and Loose photographs.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles Davis Jameson was an American civil engineer who lived and worked on railroads in China with the Perkin Syndicate between 1895-1918. He was the son of Gen. Charles Davis Jameson and Julia A. L. Smith. He graduated in 1876 from Bowdoin College and married Florence Miller on 1886 June 23. The couple had one son.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Charles Davis Jameson Papers, Photographs and Photograph Albums were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charles Davis Jameson Papers, Photographs and Photograph Albums, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0302

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: William Hillman Shockley photographs, Sidney D. Gamble photographs, Lucy Monroe Calhoun family photographs and papers

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The papers include two letters Jameson wrote to his mother; four diaries, one of which was unused; a 60-page commonplace book mainly filled with handwritten copies of published poetry, and four Japanese lithotints. The rest of the papers comprise eight typescript or published engineering reports authored by Jameson and others on Chinese projects, in English and a few in Chinese, along with two versions of Jameson's typescript description of a trip to Shanxi and Hunan.

There are also seventeen photograph albums, dated 1898 and undated, featuring 1255 black-and-white photographs ranging in size from 2.25 to 5.75 inches. There are albumen and gelatin silver prints. One of the albums is a commercial Japanese album that features hand-tinted photographs. Two albums focus on Shanxi province; three others focus on Beijing. Subjects include waterways and boats, landscapes, groups of Chinese or Westerners, engineering projects, street scenes, rural life, caravans, portraits, missionaries, houses for Westerners, farming and rice crops, and temples and other buildings. Five photographs in photograph album 2 are duplicates of photographs in the William Hillman Shockley photographs collection.

There are 5 loose photographs, four black-and-white, and one tinted, ranging in size from 8 x 4.5 inches to 11.5 x 9.5 inches. Three photographs of international locations, including Fingall's Cave, Scotland; a temple in Agra, India, and a scene of Geneva, Switzerland, are all mounted. The subjects of the other two photographs are a Chinese waterway with three boats, and a courtyard with a Western man being waited on by a Chinese servant. An additional five black-and-white photographs feature a Chinese man as an archer, holding a stone, and a wielding a kwan dao. These photographs are generally 6 x 8.25 inches and are mounted on 10 x 12.25-inch card stock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers series includes two letters Jameson wrote to his mother; four diaries, one of which was unused; a 60-page commonplace book mainly filled with handwritten copies of published poetry, and four Japanese lithotints. The rest of the series comprises eight typescript or published engineering reports authored by Jameson and others on Chinese projects, in English and a few in Chinese, along with two versions of Jameson's typescript description of a trip to Shansi and Hunan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two handwritten letters from Jameson to his mother, 2 pages and 8 pages, dated 1911 November 8 and 13.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Commercial diary filled with notes on Jameson's work and travel. Semi-regular entries July through December.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Commercial diary filled with Jameson's notes on his work, pastimes, travel, and the people he meets. Almost daily entries, except for the months of March and April.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Commercial diary with only scattered entries until August, when regular entries begin. Includes entries for 1-6 January 1911. Jamesoon was based in the United States during this year, and records his activities, visitors and visiting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a 60-page commonplace book filled with published poetry and verse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes four Japanese lithotints, sized 11.5 x 9.25, showing Japanese homes; a religious shrine; and two figures walking on a beach near a volcano, possibly Mt. Fuji.

did.unittitle: Railroad and Engineering Journal: Principles of Railway Location

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains published articles by Jameson on this subject.

did.unittitle: Railroad and Engineering Journal: The Use of Wood in Railway Structures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains published articles by Jameson on this subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a 37-page incomplete typescript, a. Accompanied by a map.

did.unittitle: Notes in Shansi and Hunan China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an approximately 119-page typescript by Jameson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains typescript reports on the Lin Tcheng Coal Mines (4 pages plus two pages maps) and the Coal basin of the Tse Chow, South Chili (8 pages).

did.unittitle: American Red Cross Report on Huai River Conservancy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a published 28-page report, with two maps, along with a seoarate Chinese translation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 43-page typescript report on reconnoissance from Hsiangyangfu, Hupeh to Hinganfu, Shensi. There are also maps, and 71 black-and-white photographs of the trip.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a 70-page published report, with extra charts and maps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seventeen photograph albums, dated 1898 and undated, featuring 1255 black-and-white photographs ranging in size from 2.25 to 5.75 inches. One of the albums is a commercial Japanese album, and features hand-tinted photographs. Two albums focus on Shanxi province; three others focus on Beijing. Subjects include waterways and boats, landscapes, groups of Chinese or Westerners, engineering projects, street scenes, rural life, caravans, portraits, missionaries, houses for Westerners, farming and rice crops, and temples and other buildings. Five photographs in photograph album 2 are duplicates of photographs in the William Hillman Shockley photographs collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Photographs in albums 1,2,3, and 17 are described individually.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album containing 72 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, all 3.375 x 2.25-inches. Topics mainly include waterways and boats, with some landscapes and a few images of Chinese people and Westerners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated phototograph album containing 72 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, all 3.375 x 2.25 inches. Photograph subjects include landscapes, engineering projects, waterways, street scenes in rural China, and caravans of various types.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album containing 36 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, around 5.75 x 4.25 inches. Subjects include mainly Chinese and Westerners, many in groups or having portraits taken, including one photograph of Charles Davis Jameson in a voluminous robe; there are also images of rural scenes, missionaries, houses for Westerners, and a monk with weapons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album featuring 72 uncaptioned and quite faded black-and-white photographs, sized 2.25 x 3 inches. Subjects include street scenes and groups of people in cities, conveyances, rural scenes, and waterways and boats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album containing 72 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, sized around 5.375 x 2.25 inches. Topics in the photographs include waterways and boats, engineering projects, as well as street and rural scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album containing 72 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, sized around 3.375 x 2.25 inches. The photographs were likely taken in Shanxi province, and include street scenes and images of waterways and boats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album contains 45 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, ranging in size from 3.75 x 2.75 inches to 5.75 x 4.25 inches. The photographs were taken in Shanxi province and feature contoured landscapes, temples and other buildings, street scenes, and engineering projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album features 36 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, ranging in size from 5.375 x 4.25 inches to 5.75 x 4.25 inches. Many of the photographs were taken in Beijing, and scenes include the Confucian Temple and Great Wall, along with landscapes, and images taken in courtyards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album features 72 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs, most about 3.375 x 2.5 inches. Photographs were taken in Beijing, and include the Ancient Observatory and Legation Compound, along with images of horseracing and street scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph album dated 1898 containing 65 black-and-white photographs, mostly 3.375 x 2.5 inches, and many with captions in pencil. The images are based in Beijing, and feature horse races; a train station; residences of Westerners; street scenes, including funerals; the Marco Polo Bridge, as well as images of the Coal region West of the city.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Japanese commercial accordion photograph album featuring 24 hand-tinted photographs, most about 5.5 x 3.625 inches. Phtotographs are uncaptioned. Images feature buildings, landscapes, waterways, with interior scenes showing Japanese women and men individually and in groups, with several portraits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Undated photograph album featuring 50 uncaptioned black-and-white photographs. Subjects include landscapes, buildings, Westerners and Chinese in groups, other groups of Chinese, waterways and boats, street scenes, groups of Western children, and religious bas reliefs. Album has been disbound.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are 5 loose photographs (four black-and-white, and one tinted), ranging in size from 8 x 4.5 inches to 11.5 x 9.5 inches. Three photographs of international locations, including Fingall's Cave, Scotland; a temple in Agra, India, and a scene of Geneva, Switzerland, are all mounted. The subjects of the other two photographs are a Chinese waterway with three boats, and a courtyard with a Western man being waited on by a Chinese servant. An additional five black-and-white photographs feature a Chinese man as an archer, a holding a stone, and a wielding a kwan dao. The photographs are generally 6 x 8.25 inches and are mounted on 10 x 12.25-inch card stock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five photographs, four black-and-white, and one tinted, ranging in size from 8 x 4.5 inches to 11.5 x 9.5 inches. Three photographs of international locations, including Fingall's Cave, Scotland; a temple in Agra, India, and a scene of Geneva, Switzerland, are all mounted. The subjects of the other two photographs are a Chinese waterway with three boats, and a courtyard with a Western man being waited on by a Chinese servant.
